Add new variables to a data_frame

transform.tbl_df.Rd

Add new variables to a data_frame

# S3 method for tbl_df
transform(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

The data_frame object to apply the transformation to
...

Name-value pairs of expressions. Use NULL to drop a variable.

Value

A copy of .data with the transformed columns

Details

This function provides a wrapper around dplyr::mutate. It implements the base::transform generic for data_frame objects.

Examples

library(dplyr)
CO2 %>% as_data_frame %>% transform(newType=Type)
#> # A tibble: 84 x 6
#>    Plant Type   Treatment   conc uptake newType
#>    <ord> <fct>  <fct>      <dbl>  <dbl> <fct>  
#>  1 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled    95   16   Quebec 
#>  2 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled   175   30.4 Quebec 
#>  3 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled   250   34.8 Quebec 
#>  4 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled   350   37.2 Quebec 
#>  5 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled   500   35.3 Quebec 
#>  6 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled   675   39.2 Quebec 
#>  7 Qn1   Quebec nonchilled  1000   39.7 Quebec 
#>  8 Qn2   Quebec nonchilled    95   13.6 Quebec 
#>  9 Qn2   Quebec nonchilled   175   27.3 Quebec 
#> 10 Qn2   Quebec nonchilled   250   37.1 Quebec 
#> # … with 74 more rows
